item.title: Creating Dotplot
item.description:
Creating Dotplot

To create a dotplot, select the Tools ‣ Build dotplot main menu item. The Build dotplot from sequences dialog will appear:

Here you should specify the File with first sequence. You should either check the Compare sequence against itself option or select the File with second sequence.

Optionally, you can choose to Join all sequences found in the file (for the first and/or second file). If you select to join the sequences, you can also specify the Gap size. The gap of the specified size will be inserted between the joined sequences.

item.title: Navigating in Dotplot
item.description:
Navigating in Dotplot

To zoom in or zoom out a dotplot, you can:

  • Rotate the mouse wheel.
  • Press the corresponding zoom buttons located on the left:

To move the zoomed region, you can:

  • Hold the middle mouse button and move the mouse cursor over the zoomed region of the dotplot.
  • Click on the desired region of the minimap in the bottom right corner.
  • Activate the Scroll tool, hold the left mouse button, and move the mouse cursor over the zoomed region:

item.title: Zooming to Selected Region
item.description:
Zooming to Selected Region

To select a dot plot region, activate the Select tool:

Hold down the left mouse button and drag the mouse cursor over the dot plot.

When you select a region on a dot plot, the corresponding region is also selected in other Sequence View areas (Sequence details view, Sequence zoom view, etc.).

The opposite is true as well: if you select a region in a Sequence View area, the corresponding region is also selected in the dot plot view.

item.title: Selecting Repeat
item.description:
Selecting Repeat

To select a repeat, activate the Select tool:

and click on the repeat:

To deselect the repeat, either click on another repeat or hold Ctrl and click somewhere on the dotplot.

item.title: Interpreting Dotplot - Identifying Matches, Mutations, Inversions, etc
item.description:
Interpreting Dotplot - Identifying Matches, Mutations, Inversions, etc

Using a dotplot graphic, you can identify the following differences between the sequences:

1. Matches

A match between sequences appears as a diagonal line on the dotplot graphic, representing a continuous match (or repeat).

2. Frame shifts

a. Mutations

Mutations are differences between sequences. On the graphic, they are represented by gaps in diagonal lines. These gaps interrupt matches.

b. Insertions

Insertions are parts of one sequence that are missing in another, while the surrounding parts match. In other words, an insertion is a subsequence that was inserted into a sequence.

item.title: Editing Parameters
item.description:
Editing Parameters

It is possible to edit the parameters of a built dot plot. Right-click on the dot plot and select the Dotplot ‣ Parameters context menu item:

The parameters dialog will be re-opened. See the description of the available parameters here.

item.title: Filtering Results
item.description:
Filtering Results

It is possible to find feature intersections and filter dotplot results. Right-click on the dotplot and select the Dotplot ‣ Filter results context menu item. The following dialog will appear:

Select features and click the OK button. The filtered dotplot will appear.

item.title: Saving Dotplot as Image
item.description:
Saving Dotplot as Image

To save a dotplot as an image, right-click on the dotplot and select the Dotplot ‣ Save/Load ‣ Save as image context menu item:

The following dialog will appear:

Available formats are *.png, *.jpg, *.bmp, *.tiff.

item.title: Saving and Loading Dotplot
item.description:
Saving and Loading Dotplot

To save a dotplot in a native format, right-click on the dotplot and select the Dotplot ‣ Save/Load ‣ Save context menu item:

The Save Dotplot dialog will appear. A dotplot is saved in a file with the *.dpt extension.

Later, the dotplot can be loaded using the Dotplot ‣ Save/Load ‣ Load context menu item.

item.title: Building Dotplot for Currently Opened Sequence
item.description:
Building Dotplot for Currently Opened Sequence

To build a dotplot for the currently opened sequences, create a multiple view containing these sequences. This can be arranged by dragging the corresponding sequence objects (the items that start with “[s]”) into the same Sequence View.

Then, right-click on the created view and select the Analyze ‣ Build dotplot item from the context menu. Every sequence from the current multiple sequence view can be used to build a dotplot.

item.title: Comparing Several Dotplots
item.description:
Comparing Several Dotplots

Dotplots created for the same view are displayed together.

If the horizontal and vertical sequences of several dotplots are the same, it is possible to lock all zooming and navigating operations for these dotplots. Press the Multiple view synchronization lock button on the left.
